primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The arrival of the Bridegroom (Christ) to sweep the waiting Church (bridesmaids) into the eternal wedding feast, overcoming the darkness of the 'time between'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the bridegroom, Jesus Christ, is arriving to sweep them up into his triumphal procession
the one who has loved us even unto death and hell, who comes again to receive those who belong to him

object.identificatie: The Wedding Feast / The Triumph of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the triumph of God in the second coming of Christ
the untrammeled joyousness of the kingdom of heaven
There is a divine agency behind this making right
according to his promise we wait
the ten bridesmaids represent the church
to receive those who belong to him
the oil of the lamps is the witness of the Spirit in the waiting church
freed from our bondage to the power of Sin
the principalities, or by the powers
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but 'the power of Sin' and 'darkness' that requires a divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church storing up 'oil' (faith/witness) to endure the long wait.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (Mother Emanuel members)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (storing oil) is the preparation for the primary program (the Bridegroom's arrival).

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Son of man will be delivered up to be crucified
the One who will come again to set things right
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The bridesmaids leap to their feet

voorbeelden: the long endurance that’s required to wait
the faithful confidence that strains forward
those of us who know Jesus
that agency cannot be overcome by the principalities
how can you forgive? ... it is our faith

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God and the Spirit-given capacity of the church, rather than human 'Devoir' (Obligation).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the darkness of the Charleston shooting (S2) through the insufficiency of human spirit (Not S1) to the eschatological triumph of Christ (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Divine Agency' that makes things right, which humans cannot do themselves.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the shooting is treated as a manifestation of cosmic Sin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects 'the triumph of the human spirit' in favor of 'the victory of the limitless love of the One who will come again.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The members of Mother Emanuel... had a readiness.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is a divine agency behind this making right.
Christian faith... simply cannot be satisfied with exclusively human hope.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Mother Emanuel church is used as an example, but the preacher explicitly attributes their strength to 'their faith' and 'the witness of the Spirit' rather than inherent human virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God sustains the church in the night.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope in the face of tragedy; reliance on God's power.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic; God is the one who 'sets things right'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The eschatological framework perfectly integrates the biblical parable with the contemporary tragedy.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the victory of the limitless love of the One who will come again to set things right

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'oil' (competence) to endure.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a power that 'rives' all groups and causes 'horrible violation'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the primary Subject of the narrative engine.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for an Advent/Apocalyptic sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death) is already portrayed as a cosmic force.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's coming) remains the foundation for Ethics (the church's forgiveness).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses a tragic event to point to the agency of God rather than the resilience of man.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the emotional impact of the Charleston story, the actantial analysis reveals that the 'hero' of the story is not the victims, but the Christ who empowers them.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the 'bride-price' or lamps vs torches; this analysis focuses on the functional role of 'readiness' as a gift of the Spirit.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model highlights how the preacher avoids the 'Exemplarism trap' by making the 'oil' a gift from the Sender (God) rather than a product of the Subject (Bridesmaids).

volledige_subject_lijst: The Church (waits, sings, forgives by faith)
appendices.notities: The sermon is a rare example of 'Apocalyptic' homiletics where human agency is properly subordinated to divine action.
